content.question: Are you and your {{ divorceWho }} domiciled in England or Wales?
content.usually: Your domicile is usually the place in which you were born, regard as your permanent home and to which you have the closest ties.
content.however: However, domicile can be more complex, for example if you or your parents have moved countries in the past.
content.domiciledExplained: When you're born, you acquire a 'domicile of origin'. This is usually:
content.fatherDomicile: your father's country of domicile if your parents were married
content.motherDomicile: your mother's country of domicile if your parents were unmarried, or your father had died before you were born
content.domicileOfChoice: If you leave your domicile of origin, settle in another country as an adult and regard it as your permanent home, the new country usually becomes your 'domicile of choice'.
content.selectYes: You should select yes if you have either type of domicile in England or Wales.
content.legalAdvice: If you're not sure about your domicile you should get legal advice.
content.instruction: Select the statement which applies to you:
content.petitioner: Only I am domiciled, my {{ divorceWho }} isn't
content.respondent: Only my {{ divorceWho }} is domiciled, I'm not
content.neither: No, neither of us are domiciled
